com.ibm.streamsx.topology

Interface TWindow<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Tuple type, any instance of T at runtime must be serializable.
    All Superinterfaces:
    TopologyElement

    public interface TWindow<T>
extends TopologyElement
    Declares a window of tuples for a TStream. Logically a Window represents an continuously updated ordered list of tuples according to the criteria that created it. For example s.last(10) declares a window that at any time contains the last ten tuples seen on stream s, while s.last(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS) is a window that always contains all tuples present in the s in the last five seconds..
    When T implements Keyable then the window is partitioned, using the value of Keyable.getKey(), this means each partition independently maintains the declared window contents for its key.
    See Also:
    TStream.last(), TStream.last(int), TStream.last(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)

    • Method Detail

      • aggregate

        <A> TStream<A> aggregate(Function<java.lang.Iterable<T>,A> aggregator,
                       java.lang.Class<A> tupleClass)
        Declares a stream that containing tuples that represent an aggregation of this window. Each time the contents of the window is updated by a new tuple being added to it, or a tuple being evicted from the window aggregator.call(tuples) is called, where tuples is an Iterable that containing all the tuples in the current window. The Iterable is stable during the method call, and returns the tuples in order of insertion into the window, from oldest to newest.
        Thus the returned stream will contain a sequence of tuples that where the most recent tuple represents the most up to date aggregation of this window or window partition.
        Parameters:
        aggregator - Logic to aggregation the complete window contents.
        tupleClass - Class of the tuples in the returned stream.
        Returns:
        A stream that contains the latest aggregations of this window.

      • aggregate

        <A> TStream<A> aggregate(Function<java.lang.Iterable<T>,A> aggregator,
                       long period,
                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                       java.lang.Class<A> tupleClass)
        Declares a stream that containing tuples that represent an aggregation of this window. Approximately every period (with unit unit) aggregator.call(tuples) is called, where tuples is an Iterable that containing all the tuples in the current window. The Iterable is stable during the method call, and returns the tuples in order of insertion into the window, from oldest to newest.
        Thus the returned stream will contain a new tuple every period seconds (according to unit) aggregation of this window or window partition.
        Parameters:
        aggregator - Logic to aggregation the complete window contents.
        period - Approximately how often to perform the aggregation.
        unit - Time unit for period.
        tupleClass - Class of the tuples in the returned stream.
        Returns:
        A stream that contains the latest aggregations of this window.

      • join

        <J,U> TStream<J> join(TStream<U> stream,
                    BiFunction<U,java.lang.Iterable<T>,J> joiner,
                    java.lang.Class<J> tupleClass)
        Join this window to a stream. This method is identical to calling stream.join(this, joiner, tupleClass).
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to join with.
        joiner - logic processing the join.
        tupleClass - Tuple type for the returned stream.
        Returns:
        Stream containing the results of the join.
        See Also:
        TStream.join(TWindow, BiFunction, Class)

      • getTupleClass

        java.lang.Class<T> getTupleClass()
        The class for tuples on this stream.
        Returns:
        The class for tuples on this stream.
